intro: Siphocampylus eichleri, commonly known as the Eichler's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to South America, specifically found in regions of Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
